sen.j: 田麩（でんぶ）は、魚肉または畜肉加工品のひとつ。
sen.e: Denbu (mashed and seasoned fish with white flesh or the mixture of fish with white flesh and shrimp that has been boiled, parched, seasoned and colored with red food coloring) is a processed food made from fish or animal meat.

Denbu (mashed and seasoned fish with white flesh or the mixture of fish with white flesh and shrimp that has been boiled, parched, seasoned and colored with red food coloring) is a processed food made from fish or livestock meat.
sen.cmt: animal meat を lovestock meat に変更
sen.e: Denbu (mashed and seasoned fish with white flesh or the mixture of fish with white flesh and shrimp that has been boiled, parched, seasoned and colored with red food coloring) is a processed food made from fish or livestock meat.

sen.j: 佃煮の一種。
sen.e: It is a type of tsukudani (a preserved food made by cooking fish, selfish, kelp, animal meat, vegetables, etc. in sweetened soy sauce).
It is a type of tsukudani (a preserved food made by cooking fish, selfish, kelp, animal meat, vegetables, etc. in sweetened soy sauce).
It is a type of tsukudani (a preserved food made by cooking fish, selfish, kelp, animal meat, vegetables, etc. in sweetened soy sauce).

sen.j: 日本では魚肉を使うことが多く、江戸前寿司の店ではおぼろと称するほか、一部では力煮（ちからに）ともいう。
sen.e: In Japan fish meat is often used to make denbu which is referred to as oboro at the Edomae-zushi (Tokyo-style sushi) restaurants and is also referred to as chikarani in some areas.
In Japan fish meat is often used to make denbu which is referred to as oboro at the Edomae-zushi (Tokyo-style sushi) restaurants and is also referred to as chikarani in some areas.
In Japan fish meat is often used to make denbu which is referred to as oboro at the Edomae-zushi (Tokyo-style sushi) restaurants and is also referred to as chikarani in some areas.

sen.j: 中華人民共和国や台湾では豚肉を使うことが多いが、鶏肉、牛肉を使うものもある。
sen.e: In China and Taiwan, pork is often used to make denbu but chicken and beef is sometimes used as well.
In China and Taiwan, pork is often used to make denbu but chicken and beef is sometimes used as well.
In China and Taiwan, pork is often used to make denbu but chicken and beef is sometimes used as well.

sen.j: 日本の田麩は魚肉を使うことが多い。
sen.e: In Japan fish meat is often used to make Denbu.
In Japan fish meat is often used to make Denbu.
In Japan fish meat is often used to make Denbu.

sen.j: 三枚におろした魚をゆで、骨や皮を取り除いた後、圧搾して水気をしぼってから焙炉にかけてもみくだき、擂り鉢で軽くすりほぐす。
sen.e: Boil the filleted fish, remove bones and skin, squeeze the fish fillets to remove water, dry in the dryer, break the fish meat into small pieces and crush in a mortar.
Boil the filleted fish, remove bones and skin, squeeze the fish fillets to remove water, dry in the dryer, break the fish meat into small pieces and crush in a mortar.
Boil the filleted fish, remove bones and skin, squeeze the fish fillets to remove water, dry in the dryer, break the fish meat into small pieces and crush in a mortar.

sen.j: その後、鍋に移して、酒・みりん・砂糖・塩で調味し煎りあげる。
sen.e: Transfer to a pot, add sake, mirin (sweet rice wine for cooking) and sugar and parch the crushed fish meat until it is fairly dry.
Transfer to a pot, add sake, mirin (sweet rice wine for cooking) and sugar and parch the crushed fish meat until it is fairly dry.
Transfer to a pot, add sake, mirin (sweet rice wine for cooking) and sugar and parch the crushed fish meat until it is fairly dry.

sen.j: 鯛などの白身魚を使用したものに食紅を加えて薄紅色に色付けすることもある。
sen.e: When fish with white flesh such as sea bream is used, food coloring is sometimes added to color denbu in pink.
When fish with white flesh such as a sea bream is used, food coloring is sometimes added to color the denbu in pink.
sen.cmt: sea breamに冠詞(a)を付与、およびdenbuに定冠詞(the)を付与。
sen.e: When fish with white flesh such as a sea bream is used, food coloring is sometimes added to color the denbu in pink.

sen.j: 薄紅色のものは、その色から桜でんぶと呼ばれる。
sen.e: The pink denbu is referred to as sakura denbu (cherry blossom denbu) after that color.
The pink denbu is referred to as sakura denbu (cherry blossom denbu) after that color.
The pink denbu is referred to as sakura denbu (cherry blossom denbu) after that color.

sen.j: 日本では魚肉田麩をご飯に振りかけるほか、ちらし寿司や巻き寿司の具とする。
sen.e: In Japan, denbu made from fish meat is used as an ingredient for chirashi zushi (literally meaning scattered sushi, a style of sushi where the topping is placed in a bowl over a bed of rice) and rolled sushi in addition to be sprinkled over rice.

In Japan, denbu made from fish meat is used as an ingredient for chirashi zushi (literally meaning scattered sushi, a style of sushi where the topping is placed in a bowl over a bed of rice) and rolled sushi in addition to be sprinkled over rice.

In Japan, denbu made from fish meat is used as an ingredient for chirashi zushi (literally meaning scattered sushi, a style of sushi where the topping is placed in a bowl over a bed of rice) and rolled sushi in addition to be sprinkled over rice.

sen.j: 伝説によれば、京のあたりの貞婦には病気で食の進まない夫がいた。
sen.e: Legend has it that, somewhere around Kyoto lived a woman of virtue whose husband had no appetite because of illness.
Legend has it that, somewhere around Kyoto lived a woman of virtue whose husband had no appetite because of illness.
Legend has it that, somewhere around Kyoto lived a woman of virtue whose husband had no appetite because of illness.

sen.j: 産土神の諭しにしたがって、土佐節を粉にして、酒と醤油とで味をととのえ供したところ、夫の食欲は進んで病気もなおった。
sen.e: The woman, according to the advice of Ubusunagami (guardian deity of one's birthplace), served her husband a dish made from dried bonito powder seasoned with sake and soy sauce which improved his appetite and he recovered from his illness.

The woman, according to the advice of Ubusunagami (a guardian deity of one's birthplace), served her husband a dish made from dried bonito powder seasoned with sake and soy sauce, which improved his appetite and he recovered from his illness.
sen.cmt: deityの前にaを追加。which improvedの前にカンマを挿入。
sen.e: The woman, according to the advice of Ubusunagami (a guardian deity of one's birthplace), served her husband a dish made from dried bonito powder seasoned with sake and soy sauce, which improved his appetite and he recovered from his illness.

sen.j: そして自分でも試み、人にもわけた。
sen.e: The woman tried that dish herself and also gave some to other people.
The woman tried that dish herself and also gave some to other people.
The woman tried that dish herself and also gave some to other people.

sen.j: これがが初めであるという。
sen.e: It is said that this was the origin of denbu.
It is said that this was the origin of denbu.
It is said that this was the origin of denbu.

sen.j: もしこれが事実となんらかの関係があるとすれば、おそらく田麩のおこりはカツオであろうという。
sen.e: If there is any credibility to this legend, it is likely that bonito was the origin of denbu.
If there is any credibility to this legend, it is likely that bonito was the origin of denbu.
If there is any credibility to this legend, it is likely that bonito was the origin of denbu.

tit.e: Denbu made from meat in China
Denbu Made from Meat in China
Denbu Made from Meat in China

sen.j: 中国語では、肉の繊維をほぐしてふんわりさせたものであることから、「肉鬆」（ロウソン、）と呼ぶのが一般的である。
sen.e: Because it is a food made by fluffing the grain of meat which has been broken into threads, is generally referred to as rou sing (dried meat threads) in Chinese.
Because it is a food made by fluffing the fibers of meat which have been broken into threads, it is generally referred to as rou sing (dried meat threads) in Chinese.
sen.cmt: 肉の繊維をgrainからfibersに変更
sen.e: Because it is a food made by fluffing the fibers of meat which have been broken into threads, it is generally referred to as rou sing (dried meat threads) in Chinese.

sen.j: 台湾語では、「肉酥」（バッソー）または「肉脯」（バッフー）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In Taiwanese (dialect), it is referred to as rou su (dried meat threads) or rou pu (dried meat threads).
In Taiwanese (dialect), it is referred to as rou su (dried meat threads) or rou pu (dried meat threads).
In Taiwanese (dialect), it is referred to as rou su (dried meat threads) or rou pu (dried meat threads).

sen.j: まれに魚肉の肉鬆も存在するが、豚肉と牛肉から作った肉鬆がより普及している。
sen.e: In rare cases, rou sing made from fish meat is available but that made from pork and beef is more common.
In rare cases, rou sing made from fish meat is available but that made from pork and beef is more common.
In rare cases, rou sing made from fish meat is available but that made from pork and beef is more common.

sen.j: 台湾では一般的に豚肉製肉鬆は淡い茶色に着色されており、牛肉製肉鬆は濃い茶色に着色されているため概観で見分けが付く。
sen.e: In Taiwan, generally, the pork rou sing sing is colored light brown, whereas, the beef rou sing is colored dark brown making them readily distinguishable.
In Taiwan, generally, the pork rou sing is colored light brown, whereas, the beef rou sing is colored dark brown making them readily distinguishable.
sen.cmt: the pork rou sing singからsingを１個除去。
sen.e: In Taiwan, generally, the pork rou sing is colored light brown, whereas, the beef rou sing is colored dark brown making them readily distinguishable.

sen.j: それ以外にも鶏肉や素食（ベジタリアン）のために大豆製品から作られた素肉鬆などがある。
sen.e: There are the chicken rou sing and the vegetarian rou sing made from soybean products for vegetarians.
There are chicken rou sing and vegetarian rou sing made from soybean products for vegetarians.
sen.cmt: chicken rou sin veegtarian rou singの前からtheを削除
sen.e: There are chicken rou sing and vegetarian rou sing made from soybean products for vegetarians.

sen.j: 中国ではお粥に乗せる事が多いが、卵焼きに混ぜ込むこともある。
sen.e: In China, rou sing is often eaten with rice porridge but is sometimes added to eggs when making an omelet.
In China, rou sing is often eaten with rice porridge but is sometimes added to eggs when making an omelet.
In China, rou sing is often eaten with rice porridge but is sometimes added to eggs when making an omelet.

sen.j: 台湾ではおにぎりや「蛋餠」と呼ばれるクレープのような朝食料理に入れたり、朝粥に乗せて食べる。
sen.e: In Taiwan, people enjoy rou sing in various ways including stuffing in rice balls, adding to the batter of crepe-like breakfast food dan bing and using as a topping for rice porridge that they eat for breakfast.

In Taiwan, people enjoy rou sing in various ways including stuffing in rice balls, adding to the batter of crepe-like breakfast food dan bing and using as a topping for rice porridge that they eat for breakfast.

In Taiwan, people enjoy rou sing in various ways including stuffing in rice balls, adding to the batter of crepe-like breakfast food dan bing and using as a topping for rice porridge that they eat for breakfast.

sen.j: 豚肉と牛肉の肉鬆は惣菜パンの定番の具にもなっている。
sen.e: The pork rou sing and beef rou sing are the regular ingredients for bun meals.
The pork rou sing and beef rou sing are regular ingredients for bun meals.
The pork rou sing and beef rou sing are regular ingredients for bun meals.
